IPILIMUMAB

Indications and doses

Treatment of unresectable or metastatic advanced melanoma,

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    (consult product literature).

Drug action

Ipilimumab causes T-cell activation.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Avoid unless potential benefit outweighs risk (toxicity in animal studies).

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Use with caution if plasma-bilirubin concentration greater than 3 times upper limit of normal range or if plasma-transaminase concentration 5 times or greater than the upper limit of normal range.

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Infusion-related side-effects,

For further information on side-effects, (including monitoring and management of side effects) consult product literature.

Immune-related reactions

A corticosteroid can be used after starting ipilimumab, to treat immune-related reactions.

National funding/access decisions

NICE TA268

Ipilimumab for previously treated advanced (unresectable or metastatic) melanoma (December 2012)

Ipilimumab is recommended as an option for the treatment of advanced (unresectable or metastatic) melanoma in patients who have received prior therapy, only if the manufacturer provides ipilimumab with the discount agreed in the patient access scheme.

www.nice.org.uk/TA268 www.nice.org.uk/TA268

NICE TA319

Ipilimumab for previously untreated advanced (unresectable or metastatic) melanoma (July 2014)

Ipilimumab is recommended, within its marketing authorisation, as an option for treating adults with previously untreated advanced (unresectable or metastatic) melanoma, only if the manufacturer provides ipilimumab with the discount agreed in the patient access scheme.

www.nice.org.uk/TA319 www.nice.org.uk/TA319

Cautions regarding administration

  • For full details consult product literature.

Advice regarding conception and contraception

Use effective contraception.

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

For information on monitoring of side effects, consult product literature.

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

Infusion-related side-effects have been reported; premedication with paracetamol and an antihistamine is recommended.

Prepared medicinal forms of IPILIMUMAB

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Solution for infusion
